Package org.jtrim.property

Contains convenience classes for defining properties able to notify clients of changes.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MutableProperty<ValueType>
    Defines a PropertySource whose value can be changed by the client code by calling the setValue method.
    MutablePropertyProxy<ValueType>
    Defines a MutableProperty which is backed by another MutableProperty.
    PropertyPublisher<ValueType>
    Defines a method which protects a value when that value is being returned.
    PropertySource<ValueType>
    Defines the value of an arbitrary property.
    PropertySourceProxy<ValueType>
    Defines a PropertySource which is backed by another PropertySource.
    PropertyVerifier<ValueType>
    Defines a method which defensively copies objects before being stored in an internal field and also verifies if the given value is valid.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    PropertyFactory
    Defines static factory methods for creating properties or propery sources.

Package org.jtrim.property Description

Contains convenience classes for defining properties able to notify clients of changes.

The two main interfaces of this package are PropertySource and MutableProperty. PropertySource might be used when there is a property which might change independently of client code and MutableProperty is a property which might be adjusted by client code.

The factory class PropertyFactory contains lots of helper methods to create various kinds of properties.

Note that usually you need to use properties in Swing components and so in this case properties are expected to be adjusted only from the AWT Event dispatch thread. Unlike in Swing however, reading properties are defined to be thread-safe by this package.

See Also:
PropertyFactory
